page.title: 12GRAYS BEACH
page.content: In Grays, on the river bank by the Thames, a small park can be seen. This area is known locally as Grays Beach. The park has hardly any facilities. The boating pool is full of stones and slime. A paddling pool is no longer in use. Some facilities in the park are swings, climbing frame and see-saw. A pier is near the yacht club, where men sometimes fish. By the pier a grating can be seen. The river bank is dirty and dull. Wood is scattered everywhere. Plastic bottles and smashed glass stop people enjoying themselves. Adjoining Grays Beach is a public open space called{KILVERT'S FIELD.} This playing field serves a nearby housing estate. Each year a funfair visits the field to the delight of the local children.
